image.altText: A young man using his phone to scroll social media.

props.synopsis: After months of build-up, the time has finally come. From today, Australians under the age of 16 are now banned from having a social media account.

title.children: Albanese tells teenagers to 'read that book' as social media ban begins

image.altText: A bespectacled, auburn-haired woman in a light jacket smiles gestures as she speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor has opened the door to interest rate hikes in 2026, but how soon will she walk through it?

title.children: 'Additional cuts are not needed' with rate hikes now on the agenda

image.altText: A man stands in front of a blackened ground in a t-shirt, with a serious look on his face.

props.synopsis: A planned power outage went ahead in the Bulahdelah area in northern NSW on Friday despite an active bushfire in the region, which later destroyed four homes.

title.children: Planned power outage impacted ability to defend homes from bushfires

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses and a suit jacket.

props.synopsis: Former defence minister Linda Reynolds says Coalition colleagues failed her and that she won't stop fighting to clear her name against "lies", no matter the cost.

title.children: 'Despicable and cruel': Reynolds launches scathing attack on government

image.altText: Donald Trump sits down for an interview.

props.synopsis: The US president has hinted he could walk away from supporting Ukraine and suggested it could cede territory to Moscow, as "Russia has the upper hand".

title.children: Trump criticises 'decaying' Europe and says 'size will win' in Ukraine

image.altText: Drone shot looking straight down at a wind turbine and its shadow across a green field

props.synopsis: Soaring costs and trenchant criticism from some put the brakes on wind and transmission as the sun shines on big solar and batteries.

title.children: Market operator switches to big solar, batteries as wind farms are becalmed

image.altText: Woman with head in hands with tax return on screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Perpetrators of financial abuse commit fraud by impersonating their partners, making them company directors in secret and putting business and tax debts in their names. The government wants to fix the problem, but will its proposed reforms go far enough?

title.children: Calls to protect victims of financial abuse caught in $11 billion debt trap

image.altText: Long rows of machines stretching into the distance at a Microsoft data center

props.synopsis: Australia has more than 250 data centres and more in the pipeline, prompting experts to warn against using drinking water to cool servers.

title.children: Demand for water cannot be an 'afterthought' in AI push

image.altText: Don Farrell wearing a suit and tie looks off into the distance.

props.synopsis: Family reunion travel is under scrutiny as new analysis shows federal MPs and senators spent $1.1 million on flying and driving their loved ones to Canberra and around Australia in 12 months.

title.children: Pollies charge taxpayers $1.1m for family travel in 12 months

image.altText: rainy weather in sydney

props.synopsis: The most widespread rain in three months will develop across New South Wales during the coming days, reducing the threat of bushfires in the lead-up to Christmas.

title.children: NSW to cop most widespread rain in months over coming days

image.altText: The scull of a dinosaur, positioned under spotlights.

props.synopsis: An ultra-rare dinosaur skeleton is being auctioned in London this week, sparking debate about the ethics of selling specimens with scientific value.

title.children: This rare dinosaur could be yours for $10m. The ethical debate is free

image.altText: A man looking concerned, wearing a black mask, white shirt and orange blazer.

props.synopsis: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

title.children: Australian man accused of smuggling cocaine tells Bali court he was 'coerced'

image.altText: A group of men sit on the back of a truck at night, some holding guns

props.synopsis: More than 140,000 civilians have been evacuated from border regions since fresh fighting between Thailand and Cambodia began on Sunday, officials said.

title.children: Thousands forced to flee as Thailand-Cambodia border clashes spread

image.altText: A young woman with olive skin and short, black curly hair. Subtle smile at camera. Trees in background

props.synopsis: Thirty-five young people have been named 2026 ABC Heywire winners for the bravery and authenticity of their life stories.

title.children: Heywire winners bring 'raw, honest storytelling' of life in the regions

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country is ready to move forward with a US-backed peace proposal.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's initial proposal to end the war was judged by Ukraine's allies to be overly favourable to Russia.

title.children: Ukraine to send US revised peace plan as Zelenskyy rules out ceding territory

image.altText: NSW Victoria border

props.synopsis: Which state has the longest land border? Test your knowledge in today's quiz.

title.children: Quiz: Test you knowledge of Australian geography

image.altText: A man with scruffy hair and beard posses with a Fellowship of the Ring movie poster.

props.synopsis: Peter Jackson's life wouldn't be the same after that red carpet event on December 10, 2001, but it's fair to say cinema, and New Zealand, wouldn't be the same either.

title.children: How Peter Jackson fought for his Middle Earth dream, armed with a VHS tape

image.altText: A hand presses against a blue flak jacket with a "PRESS" label on it.

props.synopsis: Gaza has been named the deadliest place in the world to work as a journalist by French-based press freedom advocates Reporters Without Borders.

title.children: Gaza named deadliest place for journalists in 2025

image.altText: Anika Wells press conference

props.synopsis: The sports minister maintains all her taxpayer-funded expenses have been within the guidelines.

title.children: Wells initiates audit of expenses as Shorten defends her against 'pile-on'

image.altText: man in knee deep water with shark

props.synopsis: A marine scientist warns against getting in the ocean with sharks after footage emerges of swimmers at Byron Bay next to a huge school of bait fish and hundreds of the predators.

title.children: Shark feeding frenzy at Byron Bay 'spectacular' but dangerous

image.altText: Bushfire seen from a distance at night.

props.synopsis: On the same day that residents in one Tasmanian community are returning to find if their homes are still standing after a bushfire last week, residents in north-east coastal towns are being threatened by a new out-of-control blaze.

title.children: Bushfire threat for Tasmanian coastal communities in north-east

image.altText: A middle-aged woman clutches a tarpaulin while standing near camping gear in a park.

props.synopsis: The City of Moreton Bay council has told the Supreme Court that homeless tents it destroyed were not "homes" and the human right to a home was not violated.

title.children: Destroyed homeless tents were not 'homes', council tells court

image.altText: A young woman cutting a birthday cake

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh, 41, was found guilty of the Far North Queensland woman's 2018 murder on a secluded beach north of Cairns. He then fled to India, hiding out for about four years before his arrest and extradition.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley's 'opportunistic' murderer sentenced to life in prison

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera while holding a pen next to coloured pens on the table and other people drawing

props.synopsis: Two Adelaide women have made it their mission to collect 2,000 Christmas cards for prisoners who'll spend this year's festive season behind bars.

title.children: Christmas cards remind prisoners they are 'not forgotten' over the holidays

image.altText: A photo of a Bluey-themed sensory activity set in a box.

props.synopsis: The three "sensory activity sets" from HL Toys International include sealed tubs of coloured sand which Kmart said may contain the toxic mineral.

title.children: Popular Bluey, Paw Patrol toy sets recalled over asbestos fears

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia keeps rates on hold in December at 3.6 per cent. Governor Michele Bullock says it would be wrong to think the central bank isn't prepared to raise rates.

title.children: Interest rate hikes on the table in 2026 as RBA 'uncomfortable' with inflation

image.altText: Several firefighters evacuate a victim from the site of a fire as other crews look on

props.synopsis: The fire broke out on the first floor of an office building in Indonesia's capital around midday on Tuesday, with at least 100 firefighters deployed to contain the blaze.

title.children: At least 22 killed as fire rips through office block in Jakarta

image.altText: A picture of graham richardson inside the church for his state funeral

props.synopsis: Hundreds of former and current politicians from all sides of the spectrum gathered to remember powerbroker and kingmaker Graham 'Richo' Richardson.

title.children: Richardson remembered for 'soy sauce diplomacy' at state funeral

image.altText: Trump opens his hands as he talks at a table

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has expressed frustration over his judicial nominations getting blocked as the lawyer he hand-picked as New Jersey's top federal prosecutor, Alina Habba, quits.

title.children: Trump laments he 'can't appoint anybody' as prosecutor quits unlawful tenure

image.altText: A grey-haired man in a puffer jacket and mask, apparently in handcuffs, is escorted outdoors by a number of police.

props.synopsis: Juan Orlando Hernández had been sentenced in US federal court last year to 45 years in prison for helping move tons of cocaine to the United States.

title.children: Honduras seeks arrest of ex-president Hernández after Trump pardon

image.altText: Several red cranes sit among dozens of shipping containers at a port in China

props.synopsis: China's record trade surplus comes as manufacturers seeking to avoid US President Donald Trump's tariffs ship more to Europe, Australia and South-East Asia.

title.children: China targets Europe, Australia, SE Asia as trade surplus hit $US1 trillion

image.altText: A black-and-white image of an older man in a dark shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: Woodford Folk Festival founder Bill Hauritz has died after a lengthy illness, but his grieving loved ones say his legacy will live on.

title.children: Family vows Australian festival icon's legacy will live on after death at 73

image.altText: A yellow Snapchat app logo on a black smart phone.

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for under 16s comes into effect, the tech company that is verifying ages for popular messaging app Snapchat says its methods are safe, but cybersecurity experts say any time data is transmitted there's a risk of privacy breaches.

title.children: Online privacy concerns as under-16 social media ban comes into effect

image.altText: A large blue sculpture with googly eyes on it at night.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old Mount Gambier woman appears in court in person for the first time, accused of damaging a controversial sculpture, following a campaign to raise money online for her defence.

title.children: Woman accused of googly eyes vandalism to begin negotiations with prosecution

image.altText: A bald man with glasses and a suit sitting down and talking into a microphone with his hands together.

props.synopsis: The union-run vote comes as controversial, consultant-designed redundancies continue and politicians call for resignations.

title.children: 'A glaring case study of bad governance': UTS in crisis amid no-confidence vote
